page.title: 02Ashcombe Bottom
page.content: There was difficulty going to Ashcombe Bottom because the public path that runs up through the wooded valley was covered with crops and over-growth.Obviously yhe footpath is not used by walkers very often. There were a lot of rabbits and moles in the woods.No moles were seen, but there were a lot of mole hills on the ground.We did see a number of rabbits. Many magpies were seen in the trees.A large number of cinnabar moths and tortoise-shell butterflies were also observed.Most of the cinnabar moths were on the red campion when we saw them. These are some of the wild flowers we noted:Fern,Honeysuckle,Gorse,Black- berry,Hawthorn,Buttercups,Clover, Dogrose,Red campion,Golden rod and a lot of thistles.
